intro: Achyranthes vestita, commonly known as the hairy spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with latex-producing characteristics. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The small yellow flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
